intro: Polyphragmon compressicaule, commonly known as the slender rock cress, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically has a compressed, prostrate stem with dense, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow or white, and it produces small, round pods that contain several seeds. This species is adapted to rocky and well-drained soils, often found in alpine and subalpine habitats.
